United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2106, The International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination has been opened for voting.
Shall we receive notifications when nations decide their vote on the current UN Resolution undergoing a vote?\nThese can be turned off at any time by an international decision.
UN Racial Discrimination Convention Fails Vote

United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2106, The International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination, has been defeated by vote in the United Nations General Assembly.
UN Racial Discrimination Convention Passes Vote
United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2106, The International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination, has passed its vote in the United Nations General Assembly.

We have the opportunity to vote on United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2106, The International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination, at the UN General Assembly.\nWe can either vote For it, Abstain, or vote Against it.
We have ratified the UN Racial Discrimination Convention.
Withdrawal from the Racial Discrimination Convention
We have withdrawn from the UN Racial Discrimination Convention.
